result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael L. Arndt II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: --pay fine of $250 plus costs= $568 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $768;  apply cash bail amount; the balance is to be paid in $100 per month installments commencing on 10/1/14 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in an 8 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
--serve 7 days in Jefferson County Jail, (no Huber privileges); to commence forthwith

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael L. Arndt II

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 2:56pm. 
Defendant Michael L. Arndt in court with Attorney Susan Marie Roth.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count # 1.

On Count #2, the Court sentences Mr. Arndt to:  
--serve 7 days in Jefferson County Jail, (no Huber privileges); to commence forthwith 
--1 day credit for time already served given
--pay fine of $250 plus costs= $568 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $768;  apply cash bail amount; the balance is to be paid in $100 per month installments commencing on 10/1/14 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in an 8 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
recess 3:14pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

[Clerk: MK]
case caled at 9:31am.
Defendant Michael L. Arndt in court with Attorney Susan M. Roth.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Arndt waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Mr. Arndt verifies that the Cottage Avenue address is current.
recess 9:34am. 

NEXT:  schedule Plea/Sentencing in approximately thirty days
Pre-trial conference on August 6, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Original bond document received from JESO 7/21/14

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 1:16pm. 
Defendant Michael L. Arndt in court appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Susan M. Roth.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Mr. Arndt verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint is current. 
Attorney Roth verifies that she has been retained by Mr. Arndt to represent him in this case.
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $500 cash bond, with no special conditions.
recess 1: 27pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/6/14 at 11:00am  (2) Preliminary Hearing on 8/11/14 at 9:30am.
